channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023100831
item.description:
Report X-2023100831

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: SAINT JOSEPH
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Discovered when a package handler brought to us on a pallet smoking not soon after sort started. No flames seen, just white chemical smoke. We enclosed in flapped smalls tote outside. Brought bucket of water outside next to door just in case it was needed. Stopped smoking within the hour, once we opened it up and got the peanuts out of the way. DescribePack: Loose cap not tightened. I didn't notice any cracks in the base of the bottle. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Placed product in plastic tote outside.

item.title: Report X-2023100825
item.description:
Report X-2023100825

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-01
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Open and leaking package came down the QAT on the 1/3/5 side with strong odor of alcohol. Package did not have a diamond or any other signifier on package to indicate 99.8% isopropyl alcohol was in it. DescribePack: Cap to one of the bottles was loose. Contents of bottle leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined tote and immediate brought to the haz cage.

item.title: Report X-2023100722
item.description:
Report X-2023100722

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-02
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING PACKAGE REWRAP, DISCOVERED LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT. CALLED HAZMAT HELP DESK FOR UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2023100704
item.description:
Report X-2023100704

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-07
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C THAT APPEARED TO BE WET AND STAINED ON THE OUTER CARTON. THE UNLOADER VACATED THE AREA, NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES DONNING THE PROPPER PPE. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, ONE OF THE INNER VESSELS WAS FOUND TO HAVE A LOOSE CAP BY 3/4 OF A TURN AND APPROXIMATELY 3 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD ESCAPED AND LEAKED ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUUTER CARTON WAS A SINGLE WALL 120 POUND CAPACITY FIBERBOARD BOX.

Report X-2023100723

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: REWRAP; PACKAGE LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE. RESPONDER CALLED HMMS HELP DESK, OPENED THE BOX, AND FOUND CYLENDERS. THEN RESPONDER PROCESSED THROUGH UNDECLARED PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2023100592
item.description:
Report X-2023100592

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package started leaking while package handler was loading to trailer due to tilting the box. During inspection found 1 cap completely off; small amount of contents did come in contact w/ package due to box being wet. cap is vented (small hole on top) DescribePack: Loose cap; DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a Haz tote w/ Haz bags to to processed by QA. Package handler had a first aid report; Self Care

item.title: Report X-2023100017
item.description:
Report X-2023100017

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: Berkeley
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/10/2023 at approximately 2205, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 411065 at the ramp facility in Berkeley, reporting a corrosive spill. The shipment consisted of one glass bottle, packaged inside of a fiberboard box. The shipment appears to have spilled after toppling over onto its side in a stationary vehicle and appeared to have leaked onto other packages. The additional packages were cleaned and continued in transport. The spilled package was then placed in a salvage drum and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for furhter transport.
